intro: Cleome titubans, commonly known as spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, spindly stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers that resemble spiders. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in open woodlands. Cleome titubans is a hardy annual that is easy to grow and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
